column1: Nebbi is a town in the Nebbi District of the Northern Region of Uganda. It is the site of the district headquarters.
Nebbi is located in the West Nile sub-region and is approximately 77 kilometres (48 mi)
column4: the largest town in the sub-region. This is approximately 170 kilometres (110 mi)
column7: the largest city in the Northern Region. The coordinates of the town are 2°28'45.0"N

column1: The 2002 national population census put the population of Nebbi at about 22
column3: the Uganda Bureau of Statistics (UBOS) estimated the population at 28
column5: UBOS estimated the mid-year population at 28
column7: the national population census put the population at 34

column2: Uganda Bureau of Statistics estimated the population of Nebbi to be 258
column3: 400. Districts as operational in mid-2017. Area figures of districts are derived from spatial data. The urban figures refer to municipalities and towns as defined in 2016/2017.

column1: Nebbi District currently has two constituencies of Jonam and Padyere counties after Okoro country broke off from it in 2016 to become part of present-day Zombo District. With government plans to form Pakwach District underway
column2: Nebbi will remain with a single subcounty of padyere which houses the areas of Parombo
